item.description:
This is a nice low elevation  hike through moose country. Beautiful mossy marshland, much of the hike is on planks.

We will start at Ripley Falls and end at the Zealand Trailhead where we will spot a few cars so drivers can return to Ripley Falls.

TotalsDistance 10.24 mi

Time 5 hr 47 min

Elev Gain +1335 ft

The Ethan Pond Trail enters and follows an old logging road down to a point close to the southeast corner of Ethan Pond, which however is not visible from the trail. This pond is named for its discoverer, Ethan Allen Crawford. Here, a side trail on the right leads past the inlet of Ethan Pond, where there is a view of the Twin Range over the pond, then reaches Ethan Pond Campsite in 250 yd.

The Ethan Pond Trail now descends gradually with many plank walkways, passing through semi-open bogs and beautiful spruce forest.

The Ethan Pond Trail follows the old railroad grade on a gradual curve into Zealand Notch, with its steep, fire-scarred walls. As the trail crosses the talus slopes of Whitewall Mountain, it comes into the open with fine views, and in the middle of this section, the Zeacliff Trail diverges left.

The Ethan Pond Trail soon reenters the woods and continues on the remains of the railroad grade (which is badly washed out in places) to the junction with the Zealand Trail and the Twinway.


We will finish our hike on the Zealand Trail to the parking lot.

 

bad weather or lack of interest will postpone this hike.
item.how_to_find_us: carpool from park and ride or meet at the trailhead both parking lots are $3.00 fee areas
item.name: Ethan Pond to Zealand Trail Casual Pace AT section/photo/dogs
